intro: Peucedanum matthioli, commonly known as the Italian cowparsley, is a biennial or short-lived perennial plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features slender stems and small, greenish-white flowers that appear in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Its leaves are finely divided and have a mild, spicy scent. Peucedanum matthioli is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides, growing in temperate climates.
